article.headline: McNeese State 77, Lamar 72
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) -- Jerrick Oliver scored 20 points and grabbed 10 rebounds as McNeese State beat Lamar 77-72 Saturday night. The victory snapped a four-game losing streak for McNeese (6-15, 2-8 Southland Conference). It also snapped a three-game winning streak for Lamar (10-13, 4-6). Greg Tucker scored 15 points for McNeese, Edward Garriet added 14 and 8 rebounds. Bryce May had 11. The Cardinals came into the game averaging a league-best 81.2 points a game. McNeese has been particularly porous on defense lately, allowing 89.3 points a game in the last four games, all losses. But on Saturday the Cowboys outshot Lamar 46 percent to 40 percent and outrebounded them 50-36. Gil Goodrich led Lamar with 23 points, Teddy Davis scored 18, and Blake Whittle and Terrell Petteway each had 10 points. McNeese led 42-36 at the halftime.
